title: Kamasan Penanggalan Bali
text: 'Kamasan Penanggalan Bali' is a 17th-Century Balinese classical artwork. This form of painting was originally from Kamasan village in Klungkung district. Most of the light brown color in the artwork is due to the limestone used a lot during the process (of creating). The painting has religious meaning as Balinese calendar systems, especially to determine best time or most preferable period for holding important event
